mechanoreception.notes: As planktonic free-swimmers, they likely possess mechanoreceptors for sensing water currents and disturbances, aiding in prey detection and navigation. This is inferred from their lifestyle and presence in related species of Ctenophora.

chemoreception.notes: Likely possess chemoreceptors for detecting prey and mates in the water column. This is inferred from their predatory lifestyle as comb jellies and present in related species of Ctenophora.

photoreception.notes: The presence of photoreceptors is not explicitly mentioned in the provided text, nor can it be reliably inferred, even though the mesoglea has pigments that give many nudan species a slightly pink color; Neis cordigera may be yellowish or a deep orange-red.
